page.title: 10PLANTATIONS
page.content: THE PLANTATION IN THE AREA OF { {BACONSTHORPE }IS QUITE LARGE.IT MAINLY CONSISTS OF DECIDUOUS TREES SUCH AS THE{OAK, ASH, BEECH & LIME }ETC. A LOT OF NEW PLANTATIONS ARE BEING GROWN, ESPECIALLY IN FIELDS WHERE NO CROPS (SUCH AS WHEAT) ARE BEING GROWN. A LOT OF OLD PATHS HAVE BEEN OVERGROWN AND FARMERS HAVE TURNED MANY OF THEM INTO CROP LAND.}SEVERAL PATHS HAD BEEN KEPT OPEN FOR THE USE OF FARMERS & TRACTORS BY THE EDGE OF FIELDS, BUT MOST OF THEM HAD BEEN MAINTAINED IN MORE POPULATED AREAS SUCH AS{GRESHAM {VILLAGE, FOR}THE USE OF THE INHABITANTS. MORE PLANTATIONS HAVE BEEN GROWN IN WHEAT AREAS BY THE LARGE LAND OWNERS SUCH AS THE MASTER OF NORTH BARNINGHAM HALL. A LOT OF NEW TREES HAVE BEEN PLANTED AROUND HEDGEROWS & FIELDS. {BY RICHARD LONG & CHARLES BURTON .
